headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE.; IMPORTANT FROM THE CAPITAL. Death of Hon. John Tallaferro--Interesting Movement of New--York Merchants--The French Mission, &c. Later from EI Paso--A Californian Imprisoned--The Jail Attacked by Americans--Firing of the Mexican Troops. The Mather Impeachment Case. The Episcopal Convention of Western New-York. The Epidemic at New-Orleans. Forger Captured. Encampment at Syracuse. Navigation of the Ohio. The Epidemic in New-Orleans.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hon. JOHN TALIAFERRO, a patriot and a good man. died yesterday at his residence in Virginia, aged about 85 years. He was for twenty years and upwards a member of Congress from Virginia, and for the last three years he was Librarian of the Treasury Department.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Strike of the Journeymen House Painters. Meeting of the American Party. ALLEGED SWINDLE UPON AUSTRALIA PASSENGERS. YELLOW FEVER AT THE MARINE HOSPITAL. THE DEATH IN THE UNION THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY.--FS. HEGEMEN, the apothecary MURDEROUS ATTACK. A ROW-BOAT UPEST--ONE SAILOR DROWNED--NARROW ESCAPE OF SIX OTHERS.--Yesterday morning, COLD AND HOT A YOUNG GIRL ASTRAY. THE WASHINGTON MONUMENT. LAUNCH CHURCH FOR DEAF-MUTES. BOLD ROBBERY DEATH AT SEA.

headline.main: THE DEAF AND DUMB.; Convention of the American Instructors of the Deaf and Dumb, at Columbus, Ohio. Interesting Proceedings.

docs.lead_paragraph: The third Convention of American Instruetors of the Deaf and Dumb came to an end at the hour of 7 yesterday afternoon. The Session has occupied three entire days, and the proceedings have been very harmonious ; with just a sufficiency of vinegar and spice, pleasantly intermingled, to give piquancy and variety. docs.lead_paragraph: VISIT OF THE PATTERSON LOCOMOTIVE AND MACHINE COMPANY TO THE CRYSTAL, PALACE.-The Crystal Palace yesterday received a most congenial visit. The workmen in the employ of the New Jersey Locomotive and Mach ne Company traveled from Paterson to vieit the Exhibition. They left their city about 7 o'clock,

headline.main: THE SOUTH.; Leter on the Productions, Industry and Resources of the Slabe States. NUMBER THIRTY-FOUR.

docs.lead_paragraph: Georgia Railroads--The Resources and Prosperity of the State-Sails, Agriculture. Manufactures-Character of the People--Needs of the State. I left Savannah for the West by the Macon road; the train started punctually to a second, at its advertised time; the speed was not great, but regular, and less time was lost unnecessarily at way-stations than there usually is on our Northern roads.

byline.original: CORRESPONDENCE OF THE N. Y. DAILY TIMES

headline.main: The Season at Cupe May--Defence of Promiscuous Bathing, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Quite likely I may have overlooked them, but I think you have had few or no letters from this celebrated resort this season. I therefore devote a leisure moment to write you a line.
docs.snippet: Quite likely I may have overlooked them, but I think you have had few or no letters from this celebrated resort this season. I therefore devote a leisure moment to write you a line.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New- York Daily Times

headline.main: THE EUROPEAN NEWS.; ARRIVAL OF THE AMERICA'S MAILS. Interesting Details of Foreign Intelligence. THE RUSSIAN AND TURKISH QUESTION. Interesting and Important Intelligence. The Threat to Assassinate Louis Napoleon. Improvements in Navigation at Liverpool--Lieutenant Maury. The Cholern. The Atlantic Steamers. The Affair at Smyrna. Misellaneous. French Affairs.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer America reached Boston at an early hour yesterday morning, and her mails were received in this City last evening. Our telegraphic dispatch from Halifax, published on Wednesday morning, gave a full summary of the news, which is to the 6th inst., three days later than was received by the Humboldt. The following extracts from our exchanges, however, will be found interesting.
docs.abstract: Threatened attempt at assassination by Raynaud
